designation: Professor, School of Computer Science and Engineering
biography: Dr. Mo Li is a Professor in School of Computer Science and Engineering. He received his BS degree in Department of Computer Science and Technology from Tsinghua University, and the PhD degree in Department of Computer Science and Engineering from Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. Dr. Mo Li has been internationally recognized for his research in wireless sensing and networking, IoT for smart cities and urban informatics. Dr. Li received Nanyang Research Award (Young Investigator) in 2016, a prestigious recognition to his research excellence by NTU. Dr. Li is a Distinguished Member of the ACM since 2019, and a Fellow of the IEEE since 2020.
interests: Networked and distributed systems, wireless and mobile, Internet of Things (IoT), smart city and urban computing
